title: Senior Data Scientist / Data Analyst
description: Join our Application Support Center in Warsaw and become a member of our open minded, progressive and professional team. In this role you will be working as reporting specialist on projects for one our well-known clients. You will have a chance to grow your technical and soft skills, and build a thorough expertise of the industry of our client. On top of attractive salary and benefits package, Luxoft will invest into your professional training, and allow you to grow your professional career.

title: Senior Data Scientist Warsaw
description:
Overview

As a Senior Data Scientist at dyvenia, you will be part of the Advanced Analytics team supporting one of our biggest clients in the manufacturing sector. Your ultimate goal will be to support our Business Partners on the Client organization with their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics and Data Science as a path to Innovation.

What will you do at dyvenia?

You will collaborate directly with the head of Advanced Analytics in dyvenia and the Innovation Lab within the Client organization to find and fuel use cases for Data Science, creating experiments (Proof of Concept) and guide teams made of Data Analysts, Data Scientists and Data Engineers on the End to End journey (from Idea, to Proof of Concept to Development and finally Deployment).

In this role, assisting closely Product Owners and Product Managers, your focus will be to develop models, algorithms, simulations, and experiments using the data across the business to deliver measurable impact in... various projects.

Your primary tasks will be:
‚Ä¢ Work closely with Directors/Business Stakeholders to create and adhere to Advanced Analytics / Data Science roadmaps that contribute to the Client strategic goals
‚Ä¢ Be a leader as an experienced member of an Agile Data Science team with end to end competencies that focuses on developing and deploying innovative solutions to enable and fuel business decisions.
‚Ä¢ Generating use cases for Machine Learning and Data Science in collaboration with Product Owners
‚Ä¢ Building and testing Predictive models
‚Ä¢ Applying Statistical Analysis

Additionally, you will:
‚Ä¢ Mentor other Data Scientists to support the team growth from 3 to 10 members in the next 1-2 years.
‚Ä¢ Support the Data Academy Team in the addition of Data Science best practices to the existing knowledge base, supporting Data Scientists from all departments to develop themselves seeing your team as a model.

What do we expect from you?

We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data exploration and have keen interest in understanding various business domains. Translation skills will be key as you will discuss Business needs together with technical requirements with Data Engineers and Analysts . You‚Äôll be expected to communicate those requirements in a common language to non-technical partners from various areas such as Sales, Marketing, Supply, Logistics‚Ä¶ among others.

Key requirements:
‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.
‚Ä¢ You understand and live the Agile values and practices.
‚Ä¢ You have good presentation skills.
‚Ä¢ You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.
‚Ä¢ You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas and brainstorming.

We expect that you have experience with:
‚Ä¢ Python knowledge applied to Data Science
‚Ä¢ SQL
‚Ä¢ Finding and building use cases for Machine Learning in collaboration with Product Owners
‚Ä¢ Building and testing Predictive models
‚Ä¢ Applying Statistical Analysis

We will consider it an advantage if you have experience in new development and deployment of models to production

What do we offer in return?

In return for your great skills and knowledge, we offer:
‚Ä¢ a good payment. We believe that good and honest work needs to be paid well and on time.
‚Ä¢ a lot of mentoring and training. We want you to thrive as a member of our team and for that reason, we will provide you with a lot of opportunities to grow both personally and professionally.
‚Ä¢ a relaxed working environment with lots of support, nurturing, but also creative and fun.
‚Ä¢ flexibility: you can choose to work from one of our offices in Tenerife, Krakow, Warsaw or Copenhagen or remotely
‚Ä¢ a good work-life balance. We believe that only happy, well-rested employees can work well and do good.

What are the next steps?
‚Ä¢ Apply to this vacancy by sending us your CV to recruitment@dyvenia.com.
‚Ä¢ We get back to everyone, but if you don‚Äôt hear from us within a week, send us a quick reminder.

Good luck and thank you for your time.

dyvenia team

title: Data Scientist (Python/C++)
description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist (Python/C++) with a solid experience in coding. You will have an ownership in managing the entire data lifecycle. You‚Äôll be joining a small and complex quant team that owns infrastructure and processes and is responsible for managing trading and risk management models from a FX market maker perspective. In this role you will design and build data modelling processes and production using algorithms, prototypes, predictive models, and custom analysis. We are always prototyping new technologies! Join us!

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ creating new data production and modelling processes using a variety of advanced techniques to explore data, such as data mining and machine learning
‚Ä¢ arranging random, undefined data sets using several tools simultaneously and develop custom frameworks and automation systems
‚Ä¢ optimizing the automation of testing and production processes
‚Ä¢ supporting migration from on-prem model to the cloud
‚Ä¢ developing analytical libraries
‚Ä¢... exploring and create new data pipelines
‚Ä¢ monitoring production runs to ensure timely generation of reports

Essential requirements:
‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience of coding in C++ and Python
‚Ä¢ Unix platform experience
‚Ä¢ knowledge of Google Cloud Platform

Following qualifications are beneficial:
‚Ä¢ Professional background in finance industry
‚Ä¢ University degree in finance, mathematics, computer science, physics, engineering or a related field

OANDA Global Corporation is a diverse and global team with offices around the world. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to OANDA. We are committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Learn more about our culture here

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
At Bayer we‚Äôre visionaries, driven to solve the world‚Äôs toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none‚Äô is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We‚Äôre doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‚Äòimpossible‚Äô. There are so many reasons to join us. If you‚Äôre hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there‚Äôs only one choice.

Senior Machine Learning Engineer

We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer in the IT Decision Science Pharma division

Bayer is a global enterprise with core competencies in the three main life sciences area of crop science, pharmaceuticals, & enabling functions . Its products and services are designed to benefit people and improve their quality of life. At Bayer you can be part of a culture where we... value the passion of our employees to innovate and give them the power to change

Why Bayer?

‚ÄúHealth for all and Hunger for none‚Äù is our mission at Bayer. Every day, we are privileged to work on purposeful cutting-edge projects to bring our mission to life. Join us at the new Bayer Digital Hub in Warsaw to have a career that you can put your passion into practice and make an impact using Science for a better life.

The Decision Science unit at Bayer Pharmaceutical is a one stop shop for all enterprise advanced analytics projects. We work across all functions in Bayer from Medical Affairs to Pharmacovigilance to Regulatory Affairs and others. We solve hard analytical problems and build solutions with the mission to improve the overall efficiency and decision making in the company. The focus of this team lies in applications involving Natural Language Processing techniques and patient Real World Data but does not exclude other areas of advanced analytics. If you are interested in joining a dynamic team to industrialize bleeding edge advanced analytics algorithms, we would like to hear from you.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Drive and lead business and innovation projects in the areas of Medical Affairs, Pharmacovigilance and Regulatory Affairs to deliver fit-for-purpose AI and data, i.e. fit-for-purpose AI and data solutions as part of digital products
‚Ä¢ Lead projects (technical) other ML Engineers and data scientists applying an agile approach
‚Ä¢ Lead scaling up activities transforming data science prototypes to end to end solutions embedded in business processes by leveraging skills across a large IT unit working with Business Domain Expert in their daily work.
‚Ä¢ Leads and carries out data engineering, data modeling, and AI and data infrastructure tasks.
‚Ä¢ Leads and carries out the deployment of machine learning (ML) / deep learning (DL) models and helps improve existing ML/DL models in production.
‚Ä¢ Design and Implement Cloud based Architectures ready to host ML models and pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Establish strong link with stakeholders in the business to help shape and execute the digital agenda strategy.
‚Ä¢ Create opportunities for digital product development by identifying pain points in the business to improve efficiency and decision making.
‚Ä¢ Collaborates with scientists and analysts performing business analysis and domain modeling.
‚Ä¢ Publish innovative methodologies, architectures and scientific discoveries in peer reviewed journals.

Who You Are

You are somebody (m/f/d) passionate about scaling up and deploying advanced analytics algorithms and creating the necessary data foundations to make the world a better and more efficient place. You are interested in joining an energetic team of data scientists and other machine learning engineers working across disciplines from Natural Language processing to working with patient Real World Evidence data and others. You describe yourself as hands-on, able to code, solution orientated and able to analyze data. You like to explore and try out new technologies and concepts. You can present your results and outline potential solutions for deployment to the business.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor with long term experience, Master with long term experience or PhD with several years of industry experience in machine learning, statistics, applied mathematics or computer science, with strong knowledge of machine learning and deep learning
‚Ä¢ Strong track records leading the delivery of groundbreaking machine learning or data projects.
‚Ä¢ Basic level knowledge in statistical machine learning and/or Deep Learning, in particular in Natural Language Processing
‚Ä¢ Strong experience in Data Engineering (connecting to new data sources, storing the data, choose the right storage engine and transforming and cleaning the data)
‚Ä¢ Very good knowledge of Cloud native application architecture and being able to create ML solutions in the Cloud
‚Ä¢ Very good coding knowledge in Python, familiar with at least one Cloud framework (e.g. AWS) as well as proficiency with machine learning and deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
‚Ä¢ Strong business analyst skills and strong experience interacting with very diverse customers is required
‚Ä¢ Strong skills in presentation of results and outlining of solutions to the business
‚Ä¢ Ability to work in an interdisciplinary and agile environment
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English both written and spoken

What do We offer:
‚Ä¢ A flexible, remote hybrid work model
‚Ä¢ New & exciting open office space coming in Spring ‚Äò22
‚Ä¢ Career Development & 360¬∞ Feedback
‚Ä¢ Budget for Professional Development, Training, & Conferences
‚Ä¢ Company Bonus & Reward Structure
‚Ä¢ Premium Medical Care Package (including Dental & Mental health)
‚Ä¢ Life & Travel Insurance
‚Ä¢ Multi-Sport Card with unlimited usage
‚Ä¢ Meals Subsidy in Office
‚Ä¢ Budget for Home Office Setup & Maintenance
‚Ä¢ Please send your cv in English

Our inclusive culture at Bayer:

Bayer is an equal opportunity employer. We care about inclusion in terms of gender, age, race, skin color, nationality, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, background, physical or mental disabilities and on every other grounds. Applying for our position, we assure you that we will assess your application solely on the basis of your competencies.

YOUR APPLICATION

Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

Bayer is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodations in its application process for individuals with disabilities and encourages applicants with disabilities to request any needed accommodation(s) using the contact information below.

Bayer offers the possibility of working in a hybrid model. We know how important work-life balance is, so our employees can work from home, from the office or combine both work environments. The possibilities of using the hybrid model are each time discussed with the manager

title: Data Analyst in the Data Science Hub
description:
R (nice to have)
Python (regular)
Git (regular)
SQL (regular) As the Data Science Hub Europe in Nestle, we continuously search for new talents to join our international team dedicated to delivering efficient and high-quality data solutions. You will draw even more of our attention if you have:

In return we offer:

‚Ä¢ Flexible remote work options, or ‚Äì if you prefer ‚Äì access to a modern office in Warsaw‚Äôs Mokot√≥w, walking distance from Metro Wilanowska

title: Data Analyst - Gamma Retail Catalyst
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

BCG is seeking a Data Analyst, based in Warsaw, Poland. You will join the rapidly growing Retail Catalyst team, which helps build and implement advanced analytics software for our Retail case teams and clients. Retail Catalyst is part of BCG GAMMA, BCG‚Äôs data science and software products business unit. The Warsaw-based team is in charge of building, configuring, and delivering world-class analytics software and apps.

In particular, you will be in charge of:
‚Ä¢ Supporting the Customer Success Managers (CSMs) to deliver excellent and seamless client delivery service
‚Ä¢ Rapidly take responsibility for expanding / improving use cases and help our clients achieve their analytics goals
‚Ä¢ Developing, customizing, and performance-tuning Tableau dashboards
‚Ä¢ Building and maintaining ETL flows in Dataiku
‚Ä¢ Overseeing and executing client data ingestion and data quality control
‚Ä¢ Performing analytics to support the software / apps and generating insights
‚Ä¢ Providing technical... solution and domain expertise to our clients and case teams
‚Ä¢ Coordinating with clients / case teams and maintaining a close sync with our engineering, data science, and devops teams
‚Ä¢ Proactively collecting and incorporating client and case team feedback to make the Retail Catalyst platform the best it can be
‚Ä¢ Over time, become a leader of the Warsaw Retail Catalyst team and take on management responsibility

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
The Data Analyst will have two major areas of responsibilities:
Client Service (80%)
‚Ä¢ Support onsite Customer Success Managers (CSMs) to successfully deliver Retail Catalyst projects
‚Ä¢ Work directly with clients, BCG case teams, and product team on a project-by-project basis to conduct hands-on rigorous quantitative analysis, leveraging advanced analysis software (e.g., Dataiku and Tableau for visualization)
‚Ä¢ Ingest, clean, transform, maintain, and analyze client data on Retail Catalyst platform
‚Ä¢ Rapidly configure standard and custom Tableau dashboards per CSM, client, and case team‚Äôs directions / requirements
‚Ä¢ Oversee and quality-control all things ETL and Tableau for our client deployments
‚Ä¢ Coordinate the Warsaw delivery team to provide world-class quality output and hyper-responsive client service
Product and IP development (20%)
‚Ä¢ Maintain library of client-agnostic Tableau dashboards and ETL flows
‚Ä¢ Improve setup and preparation of standard / starting point components so that they can be rapidly deployed and configured for client use cases
‚Ä¢ Support Retail Catalyst product team in client development efforts with ad hoc analysis, problem solving on best analytical approach, and client demos
‚Ä¢ Study and understand Retail sector terminology and industry (analytics-) knowledge
‚Ä¢ Over time, identify new areas of application/use cases for Retail Catalyst and help embed these into the platform and apps
Your success in this role will be measured in your ability to support our clients and case teams with highly responsive and top quality outputs. You will also be measured on your level of proactivity in terms of improving and expanding the technical platforms and analytical use cases. Finally, we will expect you to, over time, take responsibility for the Warsaw team, including development and mentorship for junior team members and overall quality control
YOU'RE GOOD AT

Technical skills
‚Ä¢ Tableau (Advanced / World class)
‚Ä¢ ETL / SQL (Advanced / World class)
‚Ä¢ Excel (Advanced)
‚Ä¢ Statistics and math (Intermediate)
‚Ä¢ Python knowledge is a plus
‚Ä¢ Data automation knowledge (e.g., Airflow) is a plus
‚Ä¢ Cloud knowledge (Google Cloud and Azure) is a plus

Non-technical skills
‚Ä¢ Meticulous attention to detail
‚Ä¢ Highly efficient ‚Äì you get a lot of work done in very little time
‚Ä¢ Willingness to work hard and prioritize team success vs. regular working hours
‚Ä¢ Highly proactive and strong drive for (self-) improvement
‚Ä¢ Dedicated team player
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills in English
‚Ä¢ World class problem-solving skills
‚Ä¢ Self-motivated and is able to operate autonomously in a structured manner
‚Ä¢ Ability to coach others
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)

Education or Certifications
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in engineering, computer science, data science / statistics, or business administration

Work Experience
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 2 years of deep experience in Tableau, including Tableau server tuning, Tableau APIs, Hyper, recent and upcoming product innovations, etc.
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 2 years of deep experience in ETL for very large data sets (terabyte+)
‚Ä¢ Deep expertise in SQL, ideally PostgreSQL
‚Ä¢ Experience in conducting thorough quality checks on ETL flows
‚Ä¢ Experience with data ingestion and automation of ingestion is a big plus
‚Ä¢ Experience with visualized ETL tools (Alteryx, Dataiku) is a big plus
‚Ä¢ Experience in working with global teams
‚Ä¢ Client service experience is a plus
‚Ä¢ Cloud platform experience is a plus
YOU'LL WORK WITH

‚Ä¢ Client success team
‚Ä¢ Tableau delivery team
‚Ä¢ Devops team
‚Ä¢ Product engineering and platform team
‚Ä¢ Commercial and product leadership

title: Data Analyst Intern
description: Our VisionFLYR Labs is focused on the relentless application of advanced and intuitive technologies that help transportation leaders unlock their ultimate potential. Starting with airlines, we provide the Cirrus Revenue Operating System‚Ñ¢ that reshapes how travel and transportation businesses plan their commercial operation. We displace legacy data, forecasting, pricing, and reporting solutions with a single enterprise SaaS platform that leverages the latest advancements in deep learning, cloud computing, and user experience.Our hyper-accurate contextual forecasts enable the most effective scheduling, marketing, and leadership decisions while directly managing the pricing for billions of dollars worth of product and revenue.As a Data Analyst you will be working in a Scrum team consisting of Backend Engineers and Data Analysts focused on delivering data metrics being a source of truth for all our products. You will support development team in daily operations required for delivery of... consistent and reliable data, define quality checks and work on improving the overall testing framework for metrics (including performance and integration tests). What your journey will look like: (Responsibilities) Define quality checks for data metrics and identify gaps in data setsVisualize data using LookerIdentify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in data setsAssist in identifying and resolving issues related to data metricsDocument changes and new featuresCreate reports and presentations What to pack for this trip: (Qualifications) Quantitative background (Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Economics, or other related fields)Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyze significant amount of data with attention to detail and accuracyTechnical knowledge regarding data models, data structures, database design.SQL skillsstrong communication skills (English) Optional carry-on: (Preferred Qualifications) Experience with data warehouses and data visualization platforms.experience working with the development of ETL systems and cloud-based data management tools.Python skills First-Class amenities: (Perks & Benefits) Gain hands-on experience working with top talent across our Engineering teamsDedicated learning and support to stimulate your growthWe provide flexible work hours for you to be at your bestHybrid working approach: work anywhere outside the office up to 2 days per weekA modern office in the heart of KrakowTop quality tech equipment so you can be at your bestA market standard internship compensation Gain meaningful relationships through working cross functionally with other interns Our Commitment to EqualityHere at FLYR, we‚Äôre committed to growing with intention, having our teams better reflect the world around us. We strive to create an environment of inclusion and even more importantly, belonging, where psychological safety, empathy, and human connection are at the center of our leadership principles. Not only does this enable us to create better products and have a better work environment, it‚Äôs good for the bottom line and it‚Äôs the right thing to do.FLYR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetics, marital or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, FLYR complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates

title: Software Engineer, DevOps
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

We are seeking an exceptional and experienced candidate to serve as DevOps Engineer for Retail Catalyst. This high-impact role will work directly with Developers, Data Scientists, Data Architects, other DevOps, Product Managers, Client Success Managers, and vendor partners (Google, Microsoft, Tableau, etc.) to own, define, improve, and implement Retail Catalyst‚Äôs DevOps roadmap. He or she will also play a crucial role in ensuring a smooth delivery of client projects, including the very important task of monitoring and improving our cloud-based platform and apps.
YOU'RE GOOD AT

You have lots of passion for cloud platforms, digital apps, and (large dataset) automation. At the same time, you also think of how to improve the business / processes and where and how you can utilize your skills to help streamline the current state of engineering & infrastructure. You should also have a relentless focus on delivering superior client service and making / keeping your... stakeholders happy.

‚Ä¢ Thoroughly understanding DevOps processes and tools like JIRA, Confluence, Octopus, Splunk, etc.
‚Ä¢ Knowing and being very comfortable with Tableau Server including setup, maintenance, user management, performance tuning, upgrades, etc.
‚Ä¢ Bringing deep experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, and/or AWS ‚Äì ideally in settings with very large (= billions of rows) of data
‚Ä¢ Bringing experience with Spark Cluster maintenance and performance tuning (especially auto-scaling)
‚Ä¢ Being on top of the latest security best practices and how to implement strong security / DevSecOps
For more information on BCG please log onto:
‚Ä¢ Setting up Various Pipelines on Azure DevOps, especially automated deployments
‚Ä¢ Supporting the upgrade and maintenance of data platforms and cloud infrastructure (Dev and Prod)
‚Ä¢ Automating and proactively improving operations around environment provisioning, installation, upgrade and maintenance
‚Ä¢ Architecting, developing, and deploying tools for monitoring, logging, and alerting
‚Ä¢ Conducting hands-on troubleshooting, problem analysis and resolution
‚Ä¢ Supporting the software engineers in building a stronger a CI/CD pipeline using tools such as Gitlab, Octopus, Skaffold (GCP), etc
‚Ä¢ Retail industry / data experience is a plus
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)

‚Ä¢ Passion for providing world-class service levels to our clients and internal stakeholders (some of them very senior)
‚Ä¢ Experience and proven success in working with fast moving, globally distributed tech teams and going above and beyond (including flexing your working hours) to make things happen
‚Ä¢ Bachelors/Master‚Äôs degree in software engineering, computer science, mathematics, or related field
‚Ä¢ Experience in deploying / maintaining data platforms & software solutions (ideally GCP and Azure ‚Äì AWS experience also a plus)
‚Ä¢ Experience working on cloud-based services (including SaaS, PaaS, IaaS) with a solid understanding of continuous integration, delivery and deployment challenges, Configuration management best practices for developing and deploying cloud applications.
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of latest DevOps tooling and practices (Atlassian JIRA, Confluence, Gitlab, OctopusDeploy, Splunk, etc.)
‚Ä¢ High proficiency with monitoring tools

YOU'LL WORK WITH

Our technology consultants and specialists partner with our clients and colleagues to build and implement digital solutions through a broad spectrum of activities. Technology jobs and engineering jobs include design of IT architectures, large-scale transformation, agile development, software engineering, cybersecurity consulting, and risk management

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We‚Äôre committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that‚Äôs welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial jetliners, defense, space and security systems, and service provider of aftermarket support.

We are looking for an accomplished Senior Data Scientist to join our team in Gdansk, Poland. Candidates can work from our office in Gdansk or in hybrid mode.

This position will be joining a team of data analysts that support Human Resources and enterprise business leaders. This role will be partnering across multiple functions to lead research projects evaluating the impact of organizational... activities on employee engagement and business objectives.

The ideal candidate for this role would have:
‚Ä¢ A passion for continuous learning, teaching and collaborating.
‚Ä¢ Experience integrating both internal and external data in order to provide robust recommendations on how employee learning, attrition, retention, and engagement impacts business objectives.
‚Ä¢ The ability to define, build and deploy artificial intelligence and machine learning solutions.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills that will enable them to work directly with stakeholders and business leaders to scope problems, explain results clearly and address any concerns in terms that can be understood by a non-technical community of stakeholders.

Position Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Develop end-to-end artificial intelligence and machine learning solutions including data processing, feature & model development and production deployment with agility and scale.
‚Ä¢ Lead and mentor small teams of data scientists in the design, development, and implementation of complex and challenging efforts in advanced analytics and machine learning.
‚Ä¢ Partner with the enterprise business functions and collaborate across multiple teams including analytics, product management, and operations to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities.
‚Ä¢ Have passion about working with large and complex unstructured and structured data sets.
‚Ä¢ Lead and contribute to design, algorithm, and code reviews.
‚Ä¢ Able to self-direct and succeed with minimal guidance.
‚Ä¢ Strong communication and interpersonal skills. You should be able to work across functions and effectively present, recommend and communicate a position by demonstrating its value and tradeoffs.

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
‚Ä¢ A technical bachelor's degree with 7+ years, or MS/MA degree with 4+ years of relevant work experience, or a relevant PhD degree. A relevant degree is defined as one in a quantitative field such as computer science, statistics, mathematics, operations research, bioinformatics, economics, computational biology, physics or chemistry.
‚Ä¢ Significant programming experience in one or more of the following: Python, Java, SQL, R.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in database management, programming, statistical modeling and/or machine learning (SQL, R, Python, JMP, Tableau, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Industry work experience or academic research in applied Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning including deep learning.
‚Ä¢ Experience and success leading small teams of technical experts in the development of advanced analytics, machine learning, or software solutions.
‚Ä¢ Work experience or relevant coursework in software engineering including work with databases (e.g., experience with SQL) and Linux systems.

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
‚Ä¢ Masters or PhD Degree preferred.
‚Ä¢ Experience and expertise building and implementing state-of-the-art computer vision models and pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Experience and expertise building and implementing state-of-the-art graph neural networks and pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Experience and expertise building and implementing state-of-the-art natural language processing models and pipelines
‚Ä¢ 2+ years work experience or relevant coursework training machine learning models in a cloud computing environment such as: AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with analytics technology stacks; Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Teradata, etc.
‚Ä¢ Good organizational, interpersonal, and problem solving skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to adjust priorities to multiple demands and unanticipated events
‚Ä¢ Highly motivated and must work well in a team environment
‚Ä¢ The ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing

Join us if you want to:
‚Ä¢ Have flexible working hours.
‚Ä¢ Enjoy additional paid days off for Winter break (December 24th-January 1st).
‚Ä¢ Develop professional skills with our virtual learning tools and platforms (O‚ÄôReilly Learning, Degreed, Enterprise Mentoring, Communities of Excellence & Practice).
‚Ä¢ Benefit from Employee Recognition Program.
‚Ä¢ Get Medical Plan (Medicover) and life insurance (Warta S.A.) for you and your Family.
‚Ä¢ Participate in Employee Pension Scheme (PPE).
‚Ä¢ Enjoy and create with us friendly and inclusive atmosphere in workplace.
‚Ä¢ Cooperate and exchange knowledge with international team where we support and respect each other.

Apply by sending your CV in English.

On Saturday, 12 March 2022, the President of the Republic of Poland signed a law to assist citizens of Ukraine in connection with the armed conflict in that country. As part of this law, Ukrainian refugees in Poland benefit from access to the Polish labour market. Boeing welcomes applications from Ukrainian refugees who are seeking employment in Poland.

Important information regarding this requisition:

This requisition is for a locally hired position in POLAND. Candidates must have current legal authorization to live and work in Poland. Benefits and pay are determined at the local level and are not part of Boeing U.S. based payroll.

Relocation:

This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

Export Control Requirements: Not an export control position

Equal Opportunity Employer:

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.

We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world‚Äôs most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process

title: Data Scientist
description:
Data Scientist (CATALYST)

Who we are looking for:

We are looking for someone who is excited about a career in the Analytics and passionate about providing industry-leading smart farming solutions to sustainably feed our world. AGCO is a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of agricultural machinery and precision Ag technology driving farmer-focused solutions. This role is part of CATALYST, AGCO's newly established Rotational Development Program.

CATALYST

CATALYST will offer you three 6 month rotations in the area of data analytics over a total of 18 months to build up knowledge in building database capabilities, developing analytics and advancing analytics, in addition to essential business and soft skills.

Upon successful completion of the program, you will have career opportunity as a Data Scientist or Data Engineer at AGCO. Candidates who apply for this program, should be interested in a long-term career path with AGCO. By joining CATALYST, you will... discover the endless career opportunities through a strong foundation of data analytics and understanding of our customers ‚Äì farmers.

What you will do (varies by rotation):
‚Ä¢ As part of the CATALYST, you will interact and work with other CATALYST trainees from different functions, such as sales and marketing, engineering, IT, etc., to build up a professional network that will benefit the rest of your career. The program also include group development activities, such as facilities tours, customer visits, hands-on farming and machinery experience, continual education, mentorship, professional development workshop, and more.
‚Ä¢ During the program you be responsible for developing statistical analysis and machine learning techniques to carry out descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics use cases in support of making farmers more productive and profitable.
‚Ä¢ This role utilizes analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets. This information is then used to develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges which will enable industry leading, smart farming solutions.
‚Ä¢ The successful candidate will participate in the adoption and advancement of analytics maturity within AGCO through the collaboration with stakeholders, delivery of insights and explanation of analysis.
‚Ä¢ Responsibilities may vary based on the person's experience, skillset, and assigned rotations.
‚Ä¢ Travel Requirement : <50% for meeting, training, and events during the CATALYST program

What you will bring:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in related field
‚Ä¢ Advanced analytics tools (Python, R, SAS, SQL etc.) to carry out statistical and machine learning analysis
‚Ä¢ Familiar with cloud technologies for model development and deployment
‚Ä¢ Fluency in English
‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

A plus if you have:
‚Ä¢ Big data computing frameworks for processing of large data volumes (AWS Glue, EMR and Sagemaker)

What we offer:

Experience our global diversity and enterprising spirit while helping us create innovative technologies and a positive impact that helps feed the world's nearly 8 billion people. From the day you decide to join AGCO, we want to engage and excite you and we're clear on where we want to go as a business and we trust you to help us there. Whether you want to learn a new skill or you aspire to do something different, we can help you develop the skills you need to take your career - and our business - to the next level.

We also invite you to "Make the Most of YOU" - Benefits include: health care and wellness plans, flexible and virtual work options (where available), 401(k) Savings Plan with company match, paid holidays and paid time off, flexible spending accounts, reimbursement for continuing education, company philanthropic programs, company perks programs, and much more...

Please note that this job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, responsibilities or benefits and may change at any time with or without notice.

AGCO is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

AGCO is a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of agricultural engineering with a portfolio of exciting international brands which deliver solutions to farmers in 140 countries through a full line offer from tractors and combine harvesters to protein production systems and smart farming software solutions ‚Äì to an environment where the future is happening now. Join us as we bring agriculture into the future

title: Mid/Senior Data Scientist with Python
description:
Python (regular)
PySpark (regular)
AWS (regular)
Data Science (advanced)

Get to know us better

CodiLime is a software and network engineering industry expert and the first-choice service partner for top global networking hardware providers, software providers and telecoms. We create proofs-of-concept, help our clients build new products, nurture existing ones and provide services in production environments. Our clients include both tech startups and big players in various industries and geographic locations (US, Japan, Israel, Europe).

While no longer a startup - we have 350+ people on board and have been operating since 2011 we've kept our people-oriented culture. Our values are simple:
‚Ä¢ Act to deliver
‚Ä¢ Disrupt to grow.
‚Ä¢ Team up to win.

The project and the team

Our client is a big consulting company, building a SaaS platform to support M&A (Merger and Acquisition) process by generating reports on companies and their competitors such as company overviews, employee sentiment... customer reviews on products and custom surveys. At the moment the platform is being heavily extended and integrated with other subsystems of the customer.

What else you should know:
‚Ä¢ The team consists of around 20 people including architects, project manager, ML developers, and multi-tech and multi-language engineers familiar with numerous APIs, data structuring and processing techniques, presenting output in multiple ways depending on the business need.
‚Ä¢ We use SCRUM/Agile methodology.
‚Ä¢ Our tech stack for the project includes: AWS infra, relational and non-relational databases (Snowflake, Postgress, ES, etc.), Spark-based processing, application frontend implemented in React with backend logic, data pipelines and transformations written in Python.
‚Ä¢ The client is based in Western Europe.

We work on multiple interesting projects at a time, so we may invite you to an interview for a different project if we see that your competencies and profile are well suited for it.

Your role

As a part of the project team, you will be responsible for:
‚Ä¢ Making decissions regarding relevant computational tools for study, experiment and trial research objectives
‚Ä¢ Compiling and interpreting analysis results
‚Ä¢ Contributing to the proposals and architecture vision delivered to the customer
‚Ä¢ Working on Data Science and Big Data related problems for different business domains
‚Ä¢ Implementing and supporting predictive models
‚Ä¢ Applying Data Mining techniques
‚Ä¢ Providing analytical support in the pipeline of Machine Learning models operationalizing proces
‚Ä¢ Presenting results directly to stakeholders and gathering business requirements
‚Ä¢ Keeping internal knowledge base information up-to-date

Do we have a match?

As a Mid/Senior Data Scientist you must meet the following knowledge/experience criteria:
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Big Data solutions and data tools in Cloud Platforms (preferably AWS with PySpark and S3)
‚Ä¢ Expertise in Data Science Specializations (NLP, Time Series Analysis, Recommender Systems, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in programming in Python
‚Ä¢ Experience in building and operationalizing machine learning models, including data manipulation, experiment design, developing analysis plans, and generating insights
‚Ä¢ Interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills to lead teams of data scientists and software engineers to successful project execution
‚Ä¢ Communication and presentation skills, including translation of complex concepts in clear, concise, and meaningful ways, that a non-technical audience can easily understand
‚Ä¢ Competence in applied statistical data analysis and solving AI problems with application to predictive and prescriptive analytics techniques
‚Ä¢ Practical expertise and extensive knowledge in Applied Statistics and Data Mining to identify hidden patterns in data, evaluate current data flow, or develop a new one
‚Ä¢ Understanding the concept of Software Development Life Cycles of AI projects

Good communication skills, English (B2 level), ability to confront technical solutions with the team and the customer's technical representatives to validate the solution with the client.

More reasons to join us
‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours and approach to work: fully remotely, in the office or hybrid
‚Ä¢ Professional growth supported by internal training sessions and a training budget
‚Ä¢ Solid onboarding with a hands-on approach to give you an easy start
‚Ä¢ A great atmosphere among professionals who are passionate about their work
‚Ä¢ The ability to change the project you work on
